original: @202a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @202a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: badzra dh'a tu ma h'a mandala de ba sarba bya basth'a na n'a ma /
analyzed: badzra dh'a tu ma h'a mandala de ba sarba bya basth'a na n'a ma /
translated: VajradhƒÅtumahƒÅma·πá·∏çaladeva sarvavyavasthƒÅnanƒÅma

original: bod skad du //
analyzed: bod skad du //
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i lha rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i lha rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Arrangement of the Deities of the Great Ma·πá·∏çala of the Vajra Realm, Called All Activities

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩ'dod chags zha sdang la sogs pa //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo // 'dod chags zha sdang la sogs pa //
translated: Homage to youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.üîΩThe kƒÅya filled with bliss,

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam spangs pa'i //üîΩsku ni bde bas kun nas gang //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam spangs pa'i // sku ni bde bas kun nas gang //
translated: free from the concepts of desire, anger, and so on,

original: rdo rje 'chad chen phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chad chen phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: homage to the great vajra holder.

original: 'di yi rigs kyi 'dod pa pos //
analyzed: 'di yi rigs kyi 'dod pa pos //
translated: Those who desire this family

original: phyag rgya chen po rtogs pa'i phyir //üîΩrdor dbyings dkyil 'khor chen po yi //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po rtogs pa'i phyir // rdor dbyings dkyil 'khor chen po yi //
translated: in order to realize the great seal

original: rnam par gzhag pa bdag gis bri //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa bdag gis bri //
translated: I will write the arrangementüîΩof the great ma·πá·∏çala of the vajra realm.

original: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma ma lus pa dang bral ba nyid de /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma ma lus pa dang bral ba nyid de /
translated: There, being free from all stains of desire and so on,

original: de las gzhan pa'i khyad par can gyi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis na me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid dang / dbye ba @202b ma lus pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid kyis na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i khyad par can gyi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis na me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid dang / dbye ba @202b ma lus pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid kyis na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: It is the essence of mirror-like primordial wisdom by virtue of being the cause of the special other-dependent nature. It is the essence of the primordial wisdom of equality by virtue of being free from all distinctions.

original: phyin ci log ma lus pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid dang / 'gro ba ma lus pa la phan pa skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma lus pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid dang / 'gro ba ma lus pa la phan pa skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: It is the essence of the primordial wisdom of individual discernment by virtue of being the nature free from all error. It is the essence of the primordial wisdom of successful activities by virtue of being the cause for the benefit of all beings.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis dang bral bas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis dang bral bas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: And it is the essence of the extremely pure expanse of reality by virtue of being free from the duality of subject and object.

original: de bas na me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yang de nyid yin pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi nga bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yang de nyid yin pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi nga bo nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the essence of all the buddhas because it is the essence of mirror-like primordial wisdom and so forth.

original: de nyid ni nye bar dmigs pa rnams las ldog pa'i stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir rdo rje sems ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni nye bar dmigs pa rnams las ldog pa'i stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir rdo rje sems ma'o //
translated: She is Vajrasattva because she is the nature of emptiness, which is the reversal of all that is perceived.

original: mtshan ma lus pa las ldog cing mtshan ma med pa'i bdag nyid can ni rin chen sems ma'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma lus pa las ldog cing mtshan ma med pa'i bdag nyid can ni rin chen sems ma'o //
translated: She is Ratnasattva because she is the nature of the signless, which is the reversal of all signs.

original: log pa'i rmi lam las ldog cing smon pa med pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na chos kyi sems ma'o //
analyzed: log pa'i rmi lam las ldog cing smon pa med pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na chos kyi sems ma'o //
translated: She is Dharmasattva because she is the nature of the wishless, which is the reversal of false dreams.

original: phyin ci log gi smon par byed pa las bzlog cing mngon par 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na las kyi sems ma'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi smon par byed pa las bzlog cing mngon par 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na las kyi sems ma'o //
translated: She is Karma-sattva because she is the nature of the non-accumulative, which is the reversal of the accumulation of error.

original: rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa rigs kyi yum bzhi ni go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa rigs kyi yum bzhi ni go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four types of consorts of the families, beginning with Vajrasattva, are the natures of the four doors of liberation, beginning with emptiness, respectively.

original: de bzhin du de nyid ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi mthar rtog pa las ldog cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi mthar rtog pa las ldog cing /
translated: In the same way, she is the nature of the reversal of the conception of the end of the world-receptacle.

original: chen po stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa byang chub kyi sems skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa byang chub kyi sems skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is the cause of generating the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the nature of the emptiness of the great.

original: mig la sogs pa nye par dmigs pa las ldog cing nang stong ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams 'gugs pa'i rgyur gyur pas rdo rje rgyal po'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nye par dmigs pa las ldog cing nang stong ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams 'gugs pa'i rgyur gyur pas rdo rje rgyal po'o //
translated: VajrarƒÅja is the cause of summoning those who have generated the Thought of Enlightenment, since it turns away from the apprehension of the eyes, etc., and is the nature of the emptiness of the inner.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas phyi stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / dgug pa rnams kyi rjes su chags pa'i rgyur gyur bas rdo rje chags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas phyi stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / dgug pa rnams kyi rjes su chags pa'i rgyur gyur bas rdo rje chags pa'o //
translated: VajrarƒÅga is the cause of the passion of those who have been summoned, since it is the nature of the emptiness of the external, turning away from the apprehension of form, etc.,

original: phyi nang gi skye mched dang lus dang gnas su nye bar dmigs pa las bzlog pas phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / chags par gyur pa'i sems kyi yid bde ba skyed par 'gyur pas rdo rje legs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi skye mched dang lus dang gnas su nye bar dmigs pa las bzlog pas phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / chags par gyur pa'i sems kyi yid bde ba skyed par 'gyur pas rdo rje legs pa'o //
translated: VajrasƒÅdhu is the cause of generating the mental satisfaction of the mind which has become passionate, since it is the nature of the emptiness of the external and internal, turning away from the apprehension of the external and internal sense-fields, the body, and the abode.

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi gnas yongs su gyur pa dag gis me long lta @203a * //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi gnas yongs su gyur pa dag gis me long lta @203a * //
translated: The mirror-like intuition is the essence of the four great emptinesses, etc., which are the cause of that intuition, by the transformation of the bases of the instincts of eye, form, etc.

original: bu'i ye shes de'i rgyur gyur pa chen po stong pa nyid la sogs pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa yin no //üîΩstong pa nyid du nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas stong ba nyid stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mngon par 'phel ba rnams kyi rgyal mtshan du dbang bskur ba'i rgyur gyur bas rdo rje rin chen no //
analyzed: bu'i ye shes de'i rgyur gyur pa chen po stong pa nyid la sogs pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa yin no // stong pa nyid du nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas stong ba nyid stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mngon par 'phel ba rnams kyi rgyal mtshan du dbang bskur ba'i rgyur gyur bas rdo rje rin chen no //
translated: The vajra-mind, etc., are the essence of the four great emptinesses, etc., which are the cause of that mirror-like intuition, by the transformation of the bases of the instincts of eye, form, etc.üîΩThe vajra-jewel is the cause of the consecration as the banner of those who have increased the spirit of enlightenment, by becoming the essence of the emptiness of emptiness, which turns away from the apprehension of emptiness.

original: don dam par nye bar dmigs pa las ldog cing don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa dang dbang bskur ba rnyed pa rnams la mi 'jigs pa rab tu sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid can du gzi brjid kyi rgyur gyur pas rdo rje gzi brjid
analyzed: don dam par nye bar dmigs pa las ldog cing don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa dang dbang bskur ba rnyed pa rnams la mi 'jigs pa rab tu sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid can du gzi brjid kyi rgyur gyur pas rdo rje gzi brjid
translated: The vajra-splendor is the cause of splendor, having the characteristic of granting fearlessness to those who have attained consecration, by becoming the essence of the emptiness of the ultimate, which turns away from the apprehension of the ultimate.

original: do // 'dus byas pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs su nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / gzi byin thob pa rnams la byams pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyur gyur pas rdo rje dpal lo //
analyzed: do // 'dus byas pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs su nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / gzi byin thob pa rnams la byams pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyur gyur pas rdo rje dpal lo //
translated: Since it turns away from the perception of the accumulation of conditioned merit, it becomes the nature of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, and since it is the cause of the loving character of those who have attained majesty, it is the vajra glory.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs kyi nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas 'dus ma byas stong ba nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / byams pa'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba'i mtshan nyid rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa bla na med pa'i yid bde ba'i rgyur gyur pas na rdo rje bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs kyi nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas 'dus ma byas stong ba nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / byams pa'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba'i mtshan nyid rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa bla na med pa'i yid bde ba'i rgyur gyur pas na rdo rje bzhad pa'o //
translated: Since it turns away from the perception of the accumulation of unconditioned enlightenment, it becomes the nature of the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, and since it is the cause of the unsurpassed mental satisfaction of the gift of Dharma for those who have the character of raising the victory banner of love, it is the vajra smile.

original: nyon mongs ba can gyi yid gnas gyur ba nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes de'i phyin ci log spong ba'i mnyam pa nyid kyi rkyen du gyur bas stong ba nyid la sogs pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid ni rdo rje rin chen la sogs pa bzhi yinüîΩno // sgro btags pa dang skur ba btab ba'i mthar nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas shin tu stong pa nyid du gyur pa dang ; chos kyi sbyin pa la yid bde ba la zhugs pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na rdo rje chos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs ba can gyi yid gnas gyur ba nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes de'i phyin ci log spong ba'i mnyam pa nyid kyi rkyen du gyur bas stong ba nyid la sogs pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid ni rdo rje rin chen la sogs pa bzhi yin no // sgro btags pa dang skur ba btab ba'i mthar nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas shin tu stong pa nyid du gyur pa dang ; chos kyi sbyin pa la yid bde ba la zhugs pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na rdo rje chos so //
translated: The four vajras, such as the vajra gem, are the nature of the four such as emptiness, because the transformation of the afflicted mind itself is the condition for the equality of the gnosis of equality, which is the equality that abandons error.üîΩThe vajra Dharma is the cause for generating the meditative stabilization of those who are engaged in the mental bliss of the gift of Dharma, because it is the extreme emptiness that turns away from the observation of superimposition and deprecation.

original: 'khor ba dmigs pa las ldog pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong ba nyid can du gyur pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rdzogs pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi ye shes skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas rdo rje rnon po'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dmigs pa las ldog pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong ba nyid can du gyur pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rdzogs pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi ye shes skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas rdo rje rnon po'o //
translated: The vajra sharpness is the cause for generating the gnosis of reality of those who have perfected meditative stabilization, because it is the emptiness that is without beginning or end, which turns away from the observation of cyclic existence.

original: dge ba'i phyogs yongs su mi gtong ba'i nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas dor ba med pa stong ba nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lor zhugs pa de rnams gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi ngor chos ston du 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pas rdo rje smra ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs yongs su mi gtong ba'i nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas dor ba med pa stong ba nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lor zhugs pa de rnams gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi ngor chos ston du 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pas rdo rje smra ba'o //
translated: The nature of the emptiness of non-rejection is that they do not turn away from the objective reference of not giving up the side of virtue.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa @203b gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ji skad du bshad pa'i phyin ci log las rnam par dben pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de'i 'khor du gyur pas shin tu stong pa nyid la sogs pa bzhi'iüîΩngo bo nyid du gyur pa ni rdo rje chos la sogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa @203b gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ji skad du bshad pa'i phyin ci log las rnam par dben pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de'i 'khor du gyur pas shin tu stong pa nyid la sogs pa bzhi'iüîΩngo bo nyid du gyur pa ni rdo rje chos la sogs pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of the emptiness of non-rejection is that they do not turn

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa chos kyi skur nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur ba dang / don dam pa'i stong pa nyid skal ba can rnams kyi rgyur gyur pas na rdo rje las so //üîΩrang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid nye bar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid las ldog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / las la rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyi bsdu ba'i rgyur gyur pas rdo rje srung ba'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa chos kyi skur nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur ba dang / don dam pa'i stong pa nyid skal ba can rnams kyi rgyur gyur pas na rdo rje las so // rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid nye bar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid las ldog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / las la rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyi bsdu ba'i rgyur gyur pas rdo rje srung ba'o //
translated: The vajra-action is the emptiness of all phenomena, which is the opposite of the apprehension of the Dharma Body as power, fearlessness, and so on, and it is the cause of the ultimate emptiness for those who are fortunate.üîΩThe vajra-protection is the emptiness of particular characteristics, which is the opposite of the apprehension of particular and general characteristics, and it is the cause of the collection for those who are engaged in action.

original: nye bar dmigs pa med pa dang nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang srung pa la sogs pa rnams kyi bgegs zhi bar byed pas rdo rje gnod sbyin no //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa med pa dang nye bar dmigs pa las ldog pas mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang srung pa la sogs pa rnams kyi bgegs zhi bar byed pas rdo rje gnod sbyin no //
translated: The vajra-yak·π£a is the emptiness of non-apprehension, which is the opposite of both non-apprehension and apprehension, and it is the pacification of obstacles for those who are engaged in protection and so on.

original: dngos bo med pa las bzlog pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / de ltar bya bsgrub pa 'jug ba rnams sku gsung thugs rdo rje byed pas dngos grub thams cad rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pas na rdo rje khu tshur ro //
analyzed: dngos bo med pa las bzlog pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pa dang / de ltar bya bsgrub pa 'jug ba rnams sku gsung thugs rdo rje byed pas dngos grub thams cad rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pas na rdo rje khu tshur ro //
translated: Since the activities of engaging in the practice of that sort are the activities of the vajra body, speech, and mind, it is the cause for the completion of all powers, and so it is the vajra fist.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ji skad du bshad pa'i phyin ci log rnams las dben pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i 'khor du gyur pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ji skad du bshad pa'i phyin ci log rnams las dben pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i 'khor du gyur pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo
translated: The wisdom of successful activities, which is the essence of the transformation of the eye consciousness and so forth, is the essence of the separation from the errors as they have been explained. Since it is the retinue of that, it is the essence of the emptiness of all phenomena and so forth.

original: bo nyid de rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bo nyid de rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the vajra and so forth.

original: de bzhin du ser sna dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang // khro ba dang // le lo la sogs pa'i nye bar dmigs pa las ldog cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du ser sna dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang // khro ba dang // le lo la sogs pa'i nye bar dmigs pa las ldog cing /
translated: Similarly, it is the turning away from the observation of stinginess, immorality, anger, laziness, and so forth.

original: de'i gnyen po nyid kyi sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang / btson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can du gyur pas phyag rgya chen po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug de ni gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid de rdo rje sgeg mo dang /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po nyid kyi sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang / btson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can du gyur pas phyag rgya chen po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug de ni gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid de rdo rje sgeg mo dang /
translated: He is the essence of Vajra Lady,

original: phreng ba dang glu ma dang gar ma'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: phreng ba dang glu ma dang gar ma'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: and of the Lady of Song and Dance.

original: rdo rje sgeg mo la sogs pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin du shes rab 'chal pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang @204a * //
analyzed: rdo rje sgeg mo la sogs pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin du shes rab 'chal pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang @204a * //
translated: Since Vajra Lady and so on are the essence of the perfection of generosity, they are the essence of the perfection of generosity.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal dang thabs med pa las log pas shes rab dang bsam gtan dang smon lam dang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi dbang phyug de
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal dang thabs med pa las log pas shes rab dang bsam gtan dang smon lam dang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi dbang phyug de
translated: Since he is the opposite of false pride and the opposite of the absence of means, he is the essence of the perfections of wisdom, concentration, aspiration, and means.

original: nyid ni phyi'i mchod pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje bdug pa dang me tog dang mar me dang dri'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: nyid ni phyi'i mchod pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje bdug pa dang me tog dang mar me dang dri'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: That very lord, the essence of the gnosis of the nondual MahƒÅmudrƒÅ, is the nature of the outer offerings, the nature of the vajra incense, flowers, lamps, and perfume.

original: rdo rje bdug pa ma la sogs pa rim pa bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje bdug pa ma la sogs pa rim pa bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Vajra incense and so on are the nature of the four perfections, such as the perfection of wisdom, respectively.

original: de nyid theg pa chen po la sogs pa la yid ches pas ma dad pa las ldog pas dad pa'i bdag nyid can de thab chen po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: de nyid theg pa chen po la sogs pa la yid ches pas ma dad pa las ldog pas dad pa'i bdag nyid can de thab chen po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
translated: Since he is the nature of faith, he is the opposite of lack of faith, since he has confidence in the MahƒÅyƒÅna and so on. Since he is the nature of great faith, he is the vajra hook, the nature of the great vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po la 'jug pa las ldog pa'i brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid can gyi spyod pa'i ngo ngo nyid du gyur pas na rdo rje zhags pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la 'jug pa las ldog pa'i brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid can gyi spyod pa'i ngo ngo nyid du gyur pas na rdo rje zhags pa'o //
translated: The vajra noose is the nature of the effort that turns away from the conduct that is the opposite of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: brjed ngas pa las ldog cing dran pa'i bdag can du gcod pa'i dgos pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na rdo rje lcags sgrog go //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa las ldog cing dran pa'i bdag can du gcod pa'i dgos pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na rdo rje lcags sgrog go //
translated: The vajra chain is the nature of the effort that turns away from the purpose of cutting and has the nature of mindfulness, which turns away from forgetfulness.

original: chos rnams mi shes pa las ldog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid can yin zhing chos thams cad ma skyes par ston pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na rdo rje 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams mi shes pa las ldog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid can yin zhing chos thams cad ma skyes par ston pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na rdo rje 'bebs pa'o //
translated: The vajra fetter is the nature of the samƒÅdhi that turns away from ignorance of phenomena and is the essence that teaches that all phenomena are unborn.

original: des na thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor chen po de nyid ni dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bor gyur pas na rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi rnal 'byor chen po de nyid ni dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bor gyur pas na rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since that very great yoga, which is the nature of method and wisdom, has the nature of faith, effort, mindfulness, and samƒÅdhi, it is the vajra hook and so on.

original: sa'i go rims nges pa gang zhe na tshogs kyi lam du byang chub tu sems skyed pa dang gdams dga' 'bogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i go rims nges pa gang zhe na tshogs kyi lam du byang chub tu sems skyed pa dang gdams dga' 'bogs pa'o //
translated: What is the order of the stages of the stages? On the path of equipment, one generates the Thought of Enlightenment and receives the precepts.

original: sbyor ba'i lam du de kho na nyid la rjes su chags pa skyed pa dang rjes su chags pa'i yid bde ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam du de kho na nyid la rjes su chags pa skyed pa dang rjes su chags pa'i yid bde ba skyes pa'o //
translated: On the path of preparation, one generates the affection for reality and the joyful mind of affection.

original: mthong ba'i lam du chos kyi mthong ba rgyun mi 'chad bar bya ba'i phyir dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam du chos kyi mthong ba rgyun mi 'chad bar bya ba'i phyir dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: On the path of insight, one receives the consecration in order to have the uninterrupted vision of reality.

original: sa gnyis pa la dbang mi 'phrogs par bya ba'i phyir mi 'jigs pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la dbang mi 'phrogs par bya ba'i phyir mi 'jigs pa skyed pa'o //
translated: On the second stage, one generates the fearlessness in order to be unassailable.

original: sa gsum pa la byang chub sems dpa' de la bde bar gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i dbang gis ;üîΩbyams pa'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba'o //üîΩsa bzhi pa la byang chub sems dpa'i de la bde bar gshegs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: sa gsum pa la byang chub sems dpa' de la bde bar gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i dbang gis ; byams pa'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba'o // sa bzhi pa la byang chub sems dpa'i de la bde bar gshegs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: On the third stage, the Bodhisattva is consecrated by the Sugata with the consecration water of the great compassion.üîΩOn the fourth stage, the Bodhisattva is consecrated by the Sugata with the banner of love.üîΩOn the fifth stage, the Bodhisattva is consecrated by the Sugata with the wheel of Dharma.

original: lnga pa la chos kyi 'khor lo de nyid ting nge gyi stobs so //
analyzed: lnga pa la chos kyi 'khor lo de nyid ting nge gyi stobs so //
translated: On the sixth stage, the Bodhisattva is consecrated by the Sugata with the strength of concentration.

original: drug pa la ni ting nge 'dzin de nyid rdzogs par byed pa'i ye shes skyed do//
analyzed: drug pa la ni ting nge 'dzin de nyid rdzogs par byed pa'i ye shes skyed do//
translated: On the sixth, he generates the gnosis that perfects that samƒÅdhi.

original: @204b bdun pa la byang chub sems dpa' de nyid sems can la snying rje skyed do //
analyzed: @204b bdun pa la byang chub sems dpa' de nyid sems can la snying rje skyed do //
translated: On the seventh, the bodhisattva generates compassion for sentient beings.

original: brgyad pa la de nyid kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: brgyad pa la de nyid kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: On the eighth, he turns the wheel of the dharma.

original: dgu pa la zag pa med pa'i mchod pas mchod do //
analyzed: dgu pa la zag pa med pa'i mchod pas mchod do //
translated: On the ninth, he is worshipped with uncontaminated offerings.

original: bcu pa la chos kyi rgyal mtshan du dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: bcu pa la chos kyi rgyal mtshan du dbang bskur ro //
translated: On the tenth, he is consecrated as the banner of the dharma.

original: bcu pa'i chos kyi ye shes chen pos bcu gcig pa la bgegs nye bar zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: bcu pa'i chos kyi ye shes chen pos bcu gcig pa la bgegs nye bar zhi bar byed do //
translated: On the eleventh, the great gnosis of the tenth level pacifies obstacles.

original: rmongs pa dang gnas ngan len pa la sogs pa'i bag la nyal rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: rmongs pa dang gnas ngan len pa la sogs pa'i bag la nyal rnams spong ngo //
translated: He abandons the latent tendencies of delusion, negative tendencies, and so on.

original: bcu gnyis pa la sku gsung thugs rdo rje ltar mi shigs pa ste rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mthar phyin to //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la sku gsung thugs rdo rje ltar mi shigs pa ste rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mthar phyin to //
translated: On the twelfth, he attains the perfection of buddhahood, with his body, speech, and mind being indestructible like a vajra.

original: de nas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyis stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang 'dus ma byas pa dang de rnams ni gzung 'dzin du ma zhen par bde ba nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: de nas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyis stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang 'dus ma byas pa dang de rnams ni gzung 'dzin du ma zhen par bde ba nyams su myong ngo //
translated: Then, by the wisdom of the ultimate realm, the mirror-like wisdom, the wisdom of equality, the wisdom of individual realization, and the wisdom of successful activities, one experiences bliss without clinging to subject and object in emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and the unconditioned.

original: rjes las thob pa'i skabs su ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / smon lam dang / thabs dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang /
analyzed: rjes las thob pa'i skabs su ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / smon lam dang / thabs dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang /
translated: In the subsequent attainment, one practices generosity, morality, patience, effort, concentration, wisdom, aspiration, skillful means, the faculty of faith, the faculty of effort,

original: dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po la spyod do //
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po la spyod do //
translated: the faculty of mindfulness, and the faculty of concentration.

original: grangs nges pa ni 'og nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: grangs nges pa ni 'og nas shes par bya'o //
translated: The definite number will be understood below.

original: de bas na rdo rje dbyings kyi lha rnams ni kun rdzob tu go rims nges ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje dbyings kyi lha rnams ni kun rdzob tu go rims nges ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the deities of the Vajra Realm are definitely in order in the conventional.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i lha rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa las don dam pa'i rnal 'byor bstan pa ste le'u dang po'o /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i lha rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa las don dam pa'i rnal 'byor bstan pa ste le'u dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the ultimate yoga in the arrangement of the deities of the Great Mandala of the Vajra Realm, the first chapter.

original: // / de nas yang /
analyzed: // / de nas yang /
translated: Then, again,

original: gzhan yang brjod par bya ba ni //üîΩrtsa ba'i bzhir gyur lha rnams kyi //
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod par bya ba ni // rtsa ba'i bzhir gyur lha rnams kyi //
translated: what is to be expressedüîΩis the conventional order of the deities

original: kun rdzob ngag gi nges pa ni //
analyzed: kun rdzob ngag gi nges pa ni //
translated: of the four main ones.

original: cung zad bsdus te bdag gis bri //
analyzed: cung zad bsdus te bdag gis bri //
translated: I will write a little bit, having summarized it.

original: de la re zhig rnam par snang mdzad ni zhal bzhi bar nges te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rnam par snang mdzad ni zhal bzhi bar nges te /
translated: First, Vairocana is definitely four-faced.

original: rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyar nges so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyar nges so //
translated: Vajraratna and so forth are definitely the pledge seals.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ni rtag ba la zhal gcig pa'o //üîΩrdo rje sems dpa' ni zhal gnyis pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ni rtag ba la zhal gcig pa'o // rdo rje sems dpa' ni zhal gnyis pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Akshobhya and so forth are always one-faced.üîΩVajrasattva has two faces.

original: rdo rje legs pa ni zhal re re dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje legs pa ni zhal re re dang ldan pa'o //
translated: VajrasƒÅdhu has one face.

original: sgeg mo la sogs pa ni bud med kyi chag lugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sgeg mo la sogs pa ni bud med kyi chag lugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: LƒÅsya and so forth hold the female form.

original: lcags kyu la sogs pa ni khro bo'i cha lugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu la sogs pa ni khro bo'i cha lugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The hook and so forth are held by the wrathful ones.

original: dris pa rnam par snang mdzad @205a * //
analyzed: dris pa rnam par snang mdzad @205a * //
translated: The questioner is Vairochana.

original: ni ci'i phyir zhal bzhir nges she na /
analyzed: ni ci'i phyir zhal bzhir nges she na /
translated: Why is he definitely four faced?

original: de ni rdo rje slob dpon la bsnyen ba kur ba ste de yang bum pa las /
analyzed: de ni rdo rje slob dpon la bsnyen ba kur ba ste de yang bum pa las /
translated: That is the service to the vajra master, and the Vase Empowerment Tantra says:

original: bde gshegs slob dpon dgyes pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bde gshegs slob dpon dgyes pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to please the Sugata master,

original: rnam par snang mdzad phyogs bzhir gzigs //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad phyogs bzhir gzigs //
translated: Vairochana looks in the four directions.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is.

original: rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyar rig pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyar rig pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúThe vajra mind and so forth are not known to be pledge seals,‚Äù

original: de ni gdul bya'i ngor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni gdul bya'i ngor bstan pa ste /
translated: that is taught in terms of the trainees.

original: de yang de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud las /
analyzed: de yang de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud las /
translated: The Compendium of Principles Tantra says:

original: mu stegs pa la phan don du //
analyzed: mu stegs pa la phan don du //
translated: In order to benefit the tirthikas,

original: sangs rgyas btsun po phyag rgyar bcas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas btsun po phyag rgyar bcas /
translated: the Buddha, the reverend, is sealed with a seal.

original: zhas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de lta na ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad la zhal gzigs par mi rigs so zhe na de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad la zhal gzigs par mi rigs so zhe na de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: That is from the perspective of the gnosis of the dharmadhatu.

original: de khro bo'i rgyud las /üîΩdper nas gzhi chen po las //
analyzed: de khro bo'i rgyud las / dper nas gzhi chen po las //
translated: The wrathful tantra states:üîΩFor example, just as

original: rtsi shing la sogs 'byung ba bzhin //üîΩchos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes las //
analyzed: rtsi shing la sogs 'byung ba bzhin // chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes las //
translated: plants and so on arise from the great earth,üîΩso too the other gnoses

original: ye shes gzhan yang 'byung phyir ro //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes gzhan yang 'byung phyir ro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: arise from the gnosis of the dharmadhatu.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ni zhal gnyis dang ldan pa dang / rdo rje rgyal po la sogs pa ni zhal gcig tu nges pa brjod de de ni gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad pa ste de yang 'brug sgra rgyas pa'i rtag pa las /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ni zhal gnyis dang ldan pa dang / rdo rje rgyal po la sogs pa ni zhal gcig tu nges pa brjod de de ni gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad pa ste de yang 'brug sgra rgyas pa'i rtag pa las /
translated: Vajrasattva and so on have two faces, and Vajraraja and so on definitely have one face. That is from the perspective of the principal deities. The extensive roar of thunder states:üîΩThey have two facesüîΩfacing each individual deity,

original: thun mong pa ni ma yin pa'i //üîΩso so dag la zhal gnyis gzigs //
analyzed: thun mong pa ni ma yin pa'i // so so dag la zhal gnyis gzigs //
translated: not common to all.

original: thun mong gtso bo nyid gcig ste //
analyzed: thun mong gtso bo nyid gcig ste //
translated: The principal deity has one face.

original: rdo rje rgyal po la sogs pa //
analyzed: rdo rje rgyal po la sogs pa //
translated: Vajraraja and so onüîΩhave one face.

original: zhal gcig nges zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhal gcig nges zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one face is definitely taught.üîΩThe forms of women such as the goddesses of grace are taught from the perspective of interest.

original: sgeg mo la sogs bud med kyi cha lugs 'dzin pa ni mos pa'i dbang du bstan pa ste de yang rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyud chen po las /
analyzed: sgeg mo la sogs bud med kyi cha lugs 'dzin pa ni mos pa'i dbang du bstan pa ste de yang rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyud chen po las /
translated: The Great Tantra of Vairochana states:

original: sems can mos pa tha dad pas //
analyzed: sems can mos pa tha dad pas //
translated: Since sentient beings have different interests,

original: sangs rgyas sku ni cir yang bstan //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku ni cir yang bstan // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the buddha body is taught in any way.üîΩThe vajra hook and so forth are held in the form of wrathful deities.üîΩThe vajra hook and so forth are definitely only in the form of wrathful deities because they subjugate the demons of afflictions and so forth and possess the characteristics of spiritual powers and so forth.

original: dris pa rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa ni khro bo'i cha lugs su 'dzin pa ji lta bu zhe na de ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bdud tshar gcod pa dang / dngos grub la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ste de ldem por bstan pa ste de yang 'jam dpal gyi rgyud las /
analyzed: dris pa rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa ni khro bo'i cha lugs su 'dzin pa ji lta bu zhe na de ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bdud tshar gcod pa dang / dngos grub la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ste de ldem por bstan pa ste de yang 'jam dpal gyi rgyud las /
translated: The Manjushri Root Tantra states:

original: nyon mongs bdud rnams tshar gcod pas //
analyzed: nyon mongs bdud rnams tshar gcod pas //
translated: Because they subjugate the demons of afflictions,

original: mchog gi dngos grub stsol bya'i phyir //
analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub stsol bya'i phyir //
translated: they grant the supreme spiritual powers.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs ni //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs ni //
translated: The vajra hook and so forth

original: khro bo'i cha lugs kho nar nges //
analyzed: khro bo'i cha lugs kho nar nges //
translated: are definitely only in the form of wrathful deities.

original: zhes gsungs te de bas na rgyal ba de dag ni bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' dag las smos pas de lta bur rtogs na shin tu 'ang @205b dam tshig nyams pa'i phyir dmus long la 'o ma'i yon tan brjod pa lta bu ste lan brjod par 'os pa
analyzed: zhes gsungs te de bas na rgyal ba de dag ni bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' dag las smos pas de lta bur rtogs na shin tu 'ang @205b dam tshig nyams pa'i phyir dmus long la 'o ma'i yon tan brjod pa lta bu ste lan brjod par 'os pa
translated: Therefore, since the victors have mentioned such in the words of the sugatas, if one understands them in that way, it is like describing the qualities of milk to a blind person, because it is a great violation of samaya.

original: ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not appropriate to say that

original: 'on kyang snying rje'i dbang gis cung zhig brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang snying rje'i dbang gis cung zhig brjod pa'o //
translated: nevertheless, due to the power of compassion, I will say a little.üîΩThe order of the questions will be explained. The wisdom free from theüîΩduality of object and subject is the essence of clarity itself, it is not divided

original: dris pa go rims nges pa gang yin de brjod de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba'i ye shes las de nyid gsal ba'i ngo bor gnas pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam par mi 'byed pa dang / bden pa nyams su myong ba dang /
analyzed: dris pa go rims nges pa gang yin de brjod de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba'i ye shes las de nyid gsal ba'i ngo bor gnas pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam par mi 'byed pa dang / bden pa nyams su myong ba dang /
translated: into self and other, and it experiences the truth.

original: 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i rgyur gyur ba dang / de nyid ni kun rdzob mtshan ma rnams las ldog pa ni rim gyis ldog pa'i phyir gtso bo'i nges pa 'khor rnams dang / rang rang gi nges pa de dang des ni ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i rgyur gyur ba dang / de nyid ni kun rdzob mtshan ma rnams las ldog pa ni rim gyis ldog pa'i phyir gtso bo'i nges pa 'khor rnams dang / rang rang gi nges pa de dang des ni ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: The reversal of the conventional from the signless is the reversal of the sequence, and the certainty of the principal is the retinue, and the certainty of each is the certainty of that.üîΩThey are applied as appropriate.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ci rigs su sbyar te gzhan dag tu rgya cher bstan pas 'dir mangs kyis dogs nas ma byas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ci rigs su sbyar te gzhan dag tu rgya cher bstan pas 'dir mangs kyis dogs nas ma byas so //
translated: They are applied as appropriate to generosity and so on, but since they are extensively presented elsewhere, I will not elaborate on them here for fear of being longwinded.

original: grangs med pa ni phyogs snga ma ltar na ma tshang ba dang mi dgos pa'i phyir dang / phyi ma lta na ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes bzhi 'byung bas de nyid re re zhing yang yon tan gyi cha bzhi bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: grangs med pa ni phyogs snga ma ltar na ma tshang ba dang mi dgos pa'i phyir dang / phyi ma lta na ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes bzhi 'byung bas de nyid re re zhing yang yon tan gyi cha bzhi bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir dang /
translated: In the former case, they are not complete and are not necessary, and in the latter case, since the wisdom of the dharmadhatu arises, each of them possesses four aspects of qualities.

original: sgeg mo la sogs pa la ni phyi nang gi mchod pa dang dgug pa dang gzhug pa la sogs pa des chog pa'i phyir te de bas na rdo rje dbyings kyi lha rnams ni don dam par grangs dang go rims nges ba'o //
analyzed: sgeg mo la sogs pa la ni phyi nang gi mchod pa dang dgug pa dang gzhug pa la sogs pa des chog pa'i phyir te de bas na rdo rje dbyings kyi lha rnams ni don dam par grangs dang go rims nges ba'o //
translated: For the goddesses such as Charm, it is sufficient to make outer and inner offerings, to summon and induct them, and so forth. Therefore, the deities of the vajra realm are definitely numbered and ordered in terms of the ultimate.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa las kun rdzob dang don dam gyi rnal 'byor bstan pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa las kun rdzob dang don dam gyi rnal 'byor bstan pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter, the chapter on the teaching of the conventional and ultimate yogas, from the arrangement of the deities of the mandala of the vajra realm.

original: // / rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba slob dpon mu ti ta ko shas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba slob dpon mu ti ta ko shas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The arrangement of the mandala of the vajra realm, composed by Master Matibhadra, is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po padma ka ra barma dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po padma ka ra barma dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
translated: The Indian preceptor Padma Karavarma and the Tibetan translator-editor Gelong Rinchen Zangpo translated, revised, and finalized this text.
